sect2.title: Installation of Lynx
sect2.para: Install Lynx by running the following commands.

userinput.command: ./configure --prefix=/usr --libdir=/etc --with-zlib && make && make install && make docdir=/usr/share/doc/lynx-&lynx-version;/lynx_doc \ helpdir=/usr/share/doc/lynx-&lynx-version;/lynx_help install-doc && make docdir=/usr/share/doc/lynx-&lynx-version;/lynx_doc \ helpdir=/usr/share/doc/lynx-&lynx-version;/lynx_help install-help

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --libdir=/etc: For some reason, the configure and make routine for lynx uses libdir as the prefix for the configuration file. We set this to /etc so that the system wide configuration file is /etc/lynx.cfg.
--with-zlib: This enables support for linking zlib into Lynx.
docdir=... helpdir=...: We set these variables to avoid getting the help and documentation files installed under /etc.
--with-ssl: This enables support for linking SSL into Lynx.
--with-gnutls: This enables support for linking GnuTLS into Lynx.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: Various settings such as proxies can be set in the system-wide lynx.cfg file found in /etc.

sect3.title: lynx
sect3.para: lynx is a general purpose, text-based, distributed information browser for the World Wide Web.
